Key Match Events: Glenn Phillips scored a century with 104 off 64 balls.
Trent Boult returned figures of 4 for 13.
New Zealand defeated Sri Lanka by 65 runs.
New Zealand were reduced to 15 for 3 at one stage.
Mitchell Santner and Ish Sodhi scalped two wickets each.
New Zealand bundled out Sri Lanka for 102.
Tim Southee picked up a wicket in the very first over without giving away any runs.
Trent Boult sent back a couple of more Lankan batters in the next over.
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson mentioned that the wicket was very different from what he expected and praised Glenn Phillips and the bowlers for their performances.
Dasun Shanaka applauded Glenn Phillips for his innings and mentioned that they lost too many wickets inside the Powerplay.
Glenn Phillips, the Player of the Match, mentioned that the plan with Daryl Mitchell was to build a partnership whilst being positive and praised the bowlers for their execution.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand top Group 1 table with 5 points.
Sri Lanka have had a long World Cup and have been unfortunate with injuries to a few key players.
Sri Lanka's inconsistent showing continues and they will have to win both their remaining games to have a good chance of making the playoffs.
